analyzed: tu nirgacchet ācāryaḥ śilpibhiḥ saha

analyzed: brāhmaṇān bhojayitvā ādau taiḥ kṛtvā svastivācanam

analyzed: ayaḥ kuṭha ādi saṃgṛhya prāc mukhaḥ vā api udak mukhaḥ

analyzed: dāru saṃgrahaṇa adhyāye saṃproktam ca adhivāsanam

analyzed: puṣṭi dā ca uttara grīvā koṇam tu parivarjayet

analyzed: utpāṭyamāne dṛśyante sphuliṅgāḥ yatra ca agni vat

analyzed: kāṃsya vat madhya bhāge tu mūle vai kāṃsya tāla vat

analyzed: tasmāt kiñcid vihīnā tu chidrāyāḥ ca dhvaniḥ bhavet

analyzed: maṇḍalāḥ yatra dṛśyante tatra garbham vinirdiśet

analyzed: pītake maṇḍale goṣṇā godhā

analyzed: gula varṇe tu pāṣāṇaḥ

analyzed: dardure syāt anārogyam godhāyām durgata ūtiḥ bhavet

analyzed: viṣeṇa mriyate sarpe anapatyaḥ tu mūṣike

translated: adorned with all ornaments, with two or four arms, two feet, O sage, shining in one's own body, having the luster of gold,

analyzed: baram ādadhat
translated: holding a conch.

analyzed: iti dhyāyet muni śreṣṭha sarva deva mayam tatas
translated: Thus, O best of sages, meditate on the embodiment of all gods.

analyzed: dhyāyan utpadyate tasya samyak jñānam tu nārada
translated: O Narada, by meditating on him, perfect knowledge arises in him.

original: iti te darśitaṃ sākṣāt mūrtaṃ tu paramātmanaḥ /
analyzed: iti te darśitam sākṣāt mūrtam tu paramātmanaḥ
translated: Thus, this embodiment of the supreme self has been directly shown to you.

original: asya mūrtasya vakṣyāmi vinyāsaṃ cāyudhasya ca // / //
analyzed: asya mūrtasya vakṣyāmi vinyāsam ca āyudhasya ca
translated: I will now describe the arrangement of this embodiment and its weapons.

original: asya dakṣiṇahastāgre cakraṃ cādhaḥ sthitasya tu /
analyzed: asya dakṣiṇa hasta agre cakram ca adhas sthitasya tu
translated: On the tip of his right hand, below, is the discus.

original: svāgatāvasthito hasta padmaṃ vā hari nārada // / //
analyzed: svāgata avasthitaḥ hasta padmam vā hari nārada
translated: The hand in the abhaya mudra holds a lotus, O Narada, O Hari.

analyzed: adhas sthitasya hasta agre ca akṣamālām tu vinyaset
translated: On the tip of the hand below, one should place the rosary.

analyzed: evam dakṣiṇa hastānām vāma pārśvasya ca ucyate
translated: Thus it is said for the hands on the right side and the left side.

analyzed: vāma pārśvasya hastānām ca ūrdhve śaṅkham vara pradam
translated: Above the hands on the left side, the conch and the boon-granting (hand) are placed.

analyzed: sa gadā kaṭi hastam syāt ittham tu parama ātmanaḥ
translated: The hand on the hip with the club should be like this for the Supreme Self.

original: vāsudevasya vakṣyāmi rūpaṃ vai cāyudhāni te /🔽gokṣīrasphaṭikākāraṃ śyāmākṛtimathāpi vā // / //
analyzed: vāsudevasya vakṣyāmi rūpam vai ca āyudhāni te  go kṣīra sphaṭika ākāram śyāma ākṛtim atha api vā

analyzed: pīta vastra dharam vā api rakta ambara dharam tu vā

analyzed: śaṅkha cakra gadā hastam sarva ābharaṇa bhūṣitam
translated: with a conch, discus, and club in the hands, adorned with all ornaments,

analyzed: sarva avayava saṃpūrṇam catur bāhu virājitam
translated: with all limbs complete, shining with four arms,

analyzed: sarva alaṃkāra saṃyuktam vāsadevam vicintayet
translated: one should contemplate Vāsudeva endowed with all ornaments.

original: vakṣyāmyasya tu hetīnāṃ vinyāsaṃ te mahāmune /🔽asya dakṣiṇahastāgre cakraṃ cādhaḥsthite 'mbujam // / //
analyzed: vakṣyāmi asya tu hetīnām vinyāsam te mahā mune  asya dakṣiṇa hasta agre cakram ca adhas sthite mbujam
translated: O great sage, I will tell you the arrangement of his weapons.🔽In front of his right hand is the discus, below it is the lotus,

original: vāmordhve śaṅkhamanyasmin gadā cāsyāpyadhomukham /🔽śriyaṃ tu dakṣiṇe pārśve vāme puṣṭiṃ tu vinyaset // / //
analyzed: vāma ūrdhve śaṅkham anyasmin gadā ca asya api adhomukham  śriyam tu dakṣiṇe pārśve vāme puṣṭim tu vinyaset
translated: above the left hand is the conch, in the other is the club, facing downwards.🔽One should place Śrī on the right side and Puṣṭi on the left side.

analyzed: tuṣṭim vā vāma pārśve tu kārayet muni sattama
translated: O best of sages, one should make Tuṣṭi on the left side.

original: evaṃ janārdanasyāpi mūrtaṃ kartavyameva tu // / //🔽ityuktaṃ vāsudevasya śṛṇu saṃkarṣaṇasya tu /
analyzed: evam janārdanasya api mūrtam kartavyam eva tu  iti uktam vāsudevasya śṛṇu saṃkarṣaṇasya tu
translated: In the same way, the form of Janardana should also be made.🔽Thus, the form of Vasudeva has been described. Listen to that of Sankarshana.

analyzed: pīta vastra dharaḥ sākṣāt catur bāhu virājitaḥ  sarva avayava saṃyuktaḥ sarva ābharaṇa bhūṣitaḥ

analyzed: sarva alaṃkāra saṃyuktaḥ śaṅkha cakra dharaḥ sadā

analyzed: iti saṃkarṣaṇaṃṇe

original: rūpamasya vai dakṣiṇe kare // / //🔽ūrdhve cakraṃ tvadho haste musalaṃ vinyaset sudhīḥ /

translated: The form of his right hand is described.🔽The wise one should place the discus above and the mace below in the hand.

analyzed: vāma ūrdhve śaṅkham iti uktam puṇḍarīkam tu adhas kare
translated: The conch is said to be above the left hand, and the lotus below in the hand.

original: dakṣiṇe tu śriyaṃ vāme puṣṭiṃ saṃsthāpayedbudhaḥ /
analyzed: dakṣiṇe tu śriyam vāme puṣṭim saṃsthāpayet budhaḥ
translated: The wise one should install Shri in the right hand and Pushti in the left hand.

original: iti saṃkarṣaṇaścoktaḥ pradyumnaṃ śṛṇu nārada // / //🔽pītāmbaraṃ caturbāhuṃ sarvāvayavasaṃyutam /
analyzed: iti saṃkarṣaṇaḥ ca uktaḥ pradyumnam śṛṇu nārada  pīta ambaram catur bāhum sarva avayava saṃyutam
translated: Thus is Sankarshana described. Listen to Pradyumna, O Narada.🔽He wears yellow garments, has four arms, and possesses all limbs.

analyzed: śaṅkha cakra gadā pāṇim sarva ābharaṇa bhūṣitam
translated: He holds a conch, discus, and mace, and is adorned with all ornaments.

analyzed: sarva alaṃkāra saṃyuktam ittham pradyumna rūpakam

analyzed: dakṣiṇa ūrdhva kare padmam adhas kaumodakīm nyaset

analyzed: ittham pradyumna mūrtam te deva ṛṣe varṇitaḥ dhunā tam mayā
translated: O celestial sage, I have now described to you the form of Pradyumna.

analyzed: śṛṇu nārada tattvataḥ

analyzed: nīla jīmūta saṃkāśam kālāñjana caya upamam

analyzed: śaṅkha cakra dharam devam pīta vastram caturbhujam

analyzed: sarva ābharaṇa saṃyuktam sarva avayava śobhitam

translated: Endowed with all ornaments, is called Aniruddha.🔽In his upper left hand, place the conch, in the other hand, the mace,

analyzed: aniruddham jagannātham ananta upari śāyinam
translated: Aniruddha, the lord of the world, lying on Ananta,

analyzed: śayane sati mūla arcā dvi bhujam vā catur bhujam
translated: When lying down, the original worship can be with two arms or four arms,

analyzed: kalpayet muni śārdūla sarva saṃpad sukha āvaham

analyzed: devasya pāda pārśve tu śriyam puṣṭim tu vinyaset

analyzed: atha vā kalpayet deva mauli pārśve śriyam mune
translated: Or, O sage, one should imagine Shri on the sides of the Lord's crown.

original: citraṃ vāpyardhacitraṃ vā citrābhāsaṃ tu vā mune // / //
analyzed: citram vā api ardhacitram vā citra ābhāsam tu vā mune
translated: Whether variegated, half-variegated, or appearing variegated, O sage,

analyzed: ittham śriyā ādi mūrtīnām pūrva pūrvā garīyasī
translated: Thus, among the forms of Shri and others, the earlier ones are more important.

analyzed: aniruddhaḥ iti proktaḥ matsya ādīn śṛṇu nārada  śatapatra mayasya atha puṇḍarīkasya madhyame
translated: Aniruddha has been mentioned. O Narada, listen to Matsya and others.🔽In the middle of a lotus made of a hundred petals,

translated: Seated in the lotus posture, surrounded by eight Matsyas, having the luster of gold,

analyzed: trinetram dvi bhujam ca eva prāc mukham padma dhāriṇam
translated: Having three eyes, two arms, facing east, holding a lotus,

analyzed: sarva avayava saṃpūrṇam sarva ābharaṇa bhūṣitam
translated: Having all the limbs complete, adorned with all ornaments,

analyzed: matsya abhimāninam no  mūrrtiṃtam
translated: The embodiment of Matsya,

analyzed: īśāna diś dale matsyam agni varṇam tu vinyaset
translated: In the northeast petal, one should place the fish of fiery color.

analyzed: iti aṣṭa diś dala sthaiḥ tu matsyaiḥ abhimṛkhīkṛtam
translated: Thus, the fish placed in the eight petals of the directions,

analyzed: matsya abhimāninam no
translated: the embodiment of the fish,

analyzed: mūrtam tava snehāt pradarśitam
translated: is displayed out of affection for you.

translated: endowed with four arms, and adorned with all ornaments.🔽With a form resembling collyrium and clay, situated in a lotus with twelve petals,

translated: Surrounded by forms with bodies resembling the color of collyrium, facing oneself, with twelve tortoises,

analyzed: pañcaviṃśati tattvāni pratimāyām nyaset tatas

analyzed: pañca upaniṣadaiḥ nyasya praṇavaiḥ saha mantra vid
translated: The knower of mantras should perform the nyasa with the five upanishads and the praṇavas.

analyzed: athavā devadevasya mantra nyāsam śṛṇu kramāt

analyzed: catur abhyadhikam viṃśat sūktam nārāyaṇam kramāt

analyzed: devasya pādau saṃspṛṣṭvā ācāryaḥ sūktam uccaran
translated: The preceptor, touching the feet of the Lord, reciting the hymn,

analyzed: nārāyaṇa upaniṣadam tris paṭhet pada saṃspṛśet

analyzed: pūjāyām adhivāse ca pratiṣṭhāyām ṣaḍakṣaram
translated: In worship, consecration, and installation, one should perform the six-syllable nyāsa.

analyzed: nyāsameṣu prakurvīta tad bimba hṛdi deśikaḥ

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena ṣaṣ akṣara japa antarakam

analyzed: gaulyam pāyasa mudga annam sa upadaṃśam ghṛta āplutam

analyzed: pañcaratna samāyuktān hema pañca āyudha anvitān

analyzed: karma arcā ca utsavam snānam baliḥ yātrā ca pañcamam

analyzed: devena saha saṃyojya devīnām muni sattama

analyzed: hema ratna yutān ca eva vastra saṃveṣṭitān śubhān

analyzed: gandha puṣpa akṣatān ca eva vastreṇa pariveṣṭitān

analyzed: tatrasthāḥ devatāḥ dhyātvā homam kuryāt vicakṣaṇaḥ

analyzed: diśā homān ca kurvīta prāsādasya samantataḥ

analyzed: sthaṇḍileṣu evam eva agnim juhuyāt dikpatīn kramāt

analyzed: dhyātvā dhyātvā sva mantreṇa samidh ādi yathākramam

analyzed: palāśa khadira aśvattha plakṣa nyagrodha bilva jāḥ

analyzed: udumbaraḥ ca kāśmaryaḥ samidhaḥ ṣṭau prakīrtitāḥ

analyzed: gomayena samālipya bāla sthānam samantataḥ

translated: Here, the wealth that is used, except for the decoration of the deity,

analyzed: ācārya dakṣiṇā ardha aṃśa tulyā sthāpaka dakṣiṇā
translated: The fee for the installer is equal to half of the fee for the preceptor.

analyzed: tad ardham mūrtipānām tu vāstuśāntikṛtaḥ tathā

analyzed: sarveṣām ca eva dātavyam vastra yugmam navam śubham

original: tāmasaṃ rājasaṃ caiva sātvikaṃ ca yathākramam /
analyzed: tāmasam rājasam ca eva sātvikam ca yathākramam
translated: the tamas, rajas and sattva in order,

analyzed: tāmasam kṛṣṇa rūpam tu rājasam rakta rūpakam
translated: the tamas is of black form, the rajas is of red form,

analyzed: sātvikam śvotavarṇam tu varṇāni etāni saṃsmaret
translated: the sattva is of white color - one should remember these colors.

analyzed: tatra tad varṇakam cintya maṇḍala upari vinyaset
translated: Having contemplated that color there, one should place it above the maṇḍala.

analyzed: tāmasa ādini vinyasya nyaset ātma dvayam budhaḥ
translated: Having placed the tamas etc., the wise one should place the two selves.

analyzed: ātmānam ca antarātmānam vāsudeva parāyaṇau
translated: The self and the inner self, both devoted to Vāsudeva.

original: ātmā tu śvetavarṇaḥ syādantarātmā tathaiva ca /
analyzed: ātmā tu śveta varṇaḥ syāt antarātmā tathā eva ca
translated: The self should be white in color, and the inner self likewise.

original: ś teṣāṃ varṇaṃ tu saṃcintya nyasedātmāntarātmake // / //
analyzed: teṣām varṇam tu saṃcintya nyaset ātma antara ātmake
translated: Having contemplated their colors, one should deposit them in the self and the inner self.

analyzed: ādhāra ādi antarātma antam nyāsa kramam atho śṛṇu
translated: Now listen to the sequence of deposition beginning with the foundation and ending with the inner self.

analyzed: ādhāram prathamam nyasya śveta varṇam trimūrti yuj
translated: Having first deposited the foundation, which is white in color and endowed with the three forms,

analyzed: śakti nyāsam dvitīye tu kanda nyāsam atas param
translated: The second is the deposition of power, after that the deposition of the bulb.

analyzed: nālam ākāśa rūpam syāt tamaḥ varṇam caturthakam
translated: The stalk should be of the nature of space, the fourth is of the color of darkness.

analyzed: nālasya āgneya koṇe tu dharmamūrtim tu pañcamam
translated: In the southeast corner of the stalk, the fifth is the form of dharma.

original: ṣaṣṭhaṃ tu nairṛte nyasya jñānamūrtiṃ tu nārada // / //
analyzed: ṣaṣṭham tu nairṛte nyasya jñāna mūrtim tu nārada
translated: O Nārada, having deposited the sixth in the southwest, the form of knowledge,

analyzed: saptame tu nyaset vidvān vairāgyam vāyugocare
translated: In the seventh, the wise one should deposit non-attachment in the direction of Vāyu.

analyzed: aiśvaryam aṣṭamam nyasya īśāne tantra vittamaḥ
translated: The best knower of the Tantra should deposit the eighth, lordship, in the northeast.

original: navamaṃ nālamūle tu rudramūrtiṃ sadāśivam /🔽daśamaṃ nālasyāgre tu pūrve 'dharmaṃ tu vinyaset // / //
analyzed: navamam nāla mūle tu rudra mūrtim sadāśivam  daśamam nālasya agre tu pūrve dharmam tu vinyaset
translated: The ninth, the form of Rudra, Sadāśiva, at the base of the stalk,🔽And the tenth, in the east, one should deposit adharma at the tip of the stalk.

analyzed: ekādaśe tu vinyasya dakṣiṇe jñāna rūpakam
translated: In the eleventh, having deposited the form of ignorance in the south,

original: paścime tu nyaset paścādavairāgyaṃ tu nārada // / //
analyzed: paścime tu nyaset paścāt avairāgyam tu nārada
translated: O Narada, one should then place the thirteenth, which is the absence of detachment, in the west.

analyzed: udīcyām vinyaset devam anaiśvaryam trayodaśa
translated: O god, one should place the fourteenth, which is the absence of lordship, in the north.

analyzed: nālasya agre smaret vidvān padmam tad parama ālayam
translated: The wise one should remember the lotus, which is the supreme abode, at the tip of the stalk.

original: etat padmāsanaṃ proktaṃ tridaśaiḥ pūjitaṃ sadā /
analyzed: etat padmāsanam proktam tridaśaiḥ pūjitam sadā
translated: This is said to be the lotus posture, which is always worshipped by the gods.

original: tatropari nyaset paścāt maṇḍalārkādi nārada // / //🔽guṇatrayaṃ nyasenmadhye tāmasādi yathākramam /
analyzed: tatra upari nyaset paścāt maṇḍala arka ādi nārada  guṇatrayam nyaset madhye tāmasa ādi yathākramam
translated: O Narada, one should then place the mandala, the sun, etc., above it.🔽One should place the three qualities in the middle, in the order of tamas, etc.

analyzed: guṇa madhye nyaset dhīmān ātmānam ca antara ātmakam
translated: The wise one should place the self, which is the inner self, in the middle of the qualities.

original: evaṃ saṃkṣepataḥ prokta āsanasya kramo mayā /
analyzed: evam saṃkṣepataḥ proktaḥ āsanasya kramaḥ mayā
translated: Thus, the sequence of the seat has been briefly described by me.

analyzed: āsanasya arcanam vakṣye saṃkṣepāt vidhi pūrvakam  ādhāra ādi antarātma antam mūrtīnām muni sattama
translated: I will now describe the worship of the seat, briefly, along with the procedure.

analyzed: vyastaiḥ saṃpūjayet sarvam samastaiḥ vā samāhitaḥ
translated: O best of sages, from the foundation up to the inner self, one should worship all the forms either separately or collectively with a concentrated mind.

analyzed: arcayet gandha puṣpa ādyaiḥ pūjayet tam manoramaiḥ
translated: One should worship him with fragrant flowers, etc., which are pleasing to the mind.

analyzed: teṣām sva nāmakaiḥ mantraiḥ dadyāt sarvam yathākramam
translated: One should offer everything in order with their respective mantras.

original: etat kalpyaṃ muniśreṣṭha āhvānaṃ ca vadāmyaham /
analyzed: etat kalpyam muni śreṣṭhaḥ āhvānam ca vadāmi aham
translated: O best of sages, this is the arrangement. I will now tell you about the invocation.

analyzed: svarṇa ādi anyatamam pātram kuḍuba dvaya pūritam
translated: A vessel made of gold or any other metal, filled with two kuḍubas (of water).

original: itthaṃ hi lakṣaṇaṃ proktaṃ sarvapātrāṇi nārada /
analyzed: ittham hi lakṣaṇam proktam sarva pātrāṇi nārada
translated: Thus, O Nārada, the characteristics of all vessels have been described.

original: āvāhanādi pātraṃ tat pañcaṣaṭsapta eva vā // / //
analyzed: āvāhana ādi pātram tat pañca ṣaṣ sapta eva vā
translated: The invocation and other rites are performed in a vessel, which may be five, six, or seven in number.

analyzed: pūjakasya agratas sthāpya prokṣayet mūlavidyayā
translated: Placing it in front of the worshipper, he should sprinkle it with the root mantra.

analyzed: eteṣām api alābhe tu śaṅkha śuktim atha api vā
translated: If these are not available, one should use a conch shell or a pearl oyster.

analyzed: kṣālayet sarva pātrāṇi viṣṇugāyatriyā mune
translated: O sage, all the vessels should be washed with the Viṣṇu Gāyatrī mantra.

analyzed: āḍhaka dvaya saṃpūrṇām pakva bimba phala ākṛtim
translated: Filled with two āḍhakas (of water), shaped like a ripe bimba fruit,

analyzed: vardhanīm vāma pārśve tu vinyasya āpūrayet budhaḥ
translated: the wise one should place the vardhanī on the left side and fill it.

analyzed: gālitaiḥ udakaiḥ yasyām gandha puṣpa yutām nyaset
translated: In which, with melted water, he should place it along with fragrance and flowers,

original: śeṣaṃ dakṣiṇapārśve tu parito vāgrato 'pi vā /
analyzed: śeṣam dakṣiṇa pārśve tu paritas vā agratas vā
translated: the rest on the right side, all around, or in front,

analyzed: sthāpayet tu krameṇa eva pūjā dravyam samastakam
translated: one should place in order the entire collection of worship articles.

analyzed: tat pātreṣu eka pātram tu saṃgṛhya muni sattama
translated: O best of sages, having collected one vessel from those vessels,

original: ṣaḍakṣareṇa mantreṇa saṃprokṣya tu punaḥ punaḥ // / //
analyzed: ṣaṣ akṣareṇa mantreṇa saṃprokṣya tu punar punar
translated: and having sprinkled it again and again with the six-syllable mantra,

original: tatpātraṃ tu punaḥ prokṣya gandhodena prapūrayet /
analyzed: tat pātram tu punar prokṣya gandhodena prapūrayet
translated: one should again sprinkle that vessel and fill it with fragrant water.

analyzed: tasmin śirasi
translated: That vessel on the head.

analyzed: puṣpam ca nyaset toyam sa puṣpakam
translated: And place the flower and water with the flower.

analyzed: uddhṛtya pūjā mantreṇa dhyātvā atra mahā mune
translated: Having recited the worship mantra, meditating on the great sage here,

analyzed: yad rūpam cintitam samyak tad rūpam cintya
translated: The form that is properly contemplated, that form should be contemplated.

analyzed: sādhakaḥ
translated: The practitioner...

analyzed: avatīrṇam mahāberāt āgaccha antena mūrdhni ca
translated: Having descended from the great mountain, having come to the top of the head,

analyzed: prokṣya ca eva āsanam dadyāt kevalena jagadguroḥ
translated: And having sprinkled, one should offer the seat with the pure one of the world teacher...

original: prakṣipya vādamūle tu puṣpamuṣṭiṃ tataḥ param /🔽namaskṛtyāñjaliṃ paścāt darśayenmunisattama // / //
analyzed: prakṣipya vāda mūle tu puṣpa muṣṭim tatas param  namaskṛtya añjalim paścāt darśayet muni sattama
translated: Having thrown a handful of flowers at the root of the mantra, then after that,🔽Having bowed, one should show the folded hands, O best of sages...

original: ardhyaṃ pādyaṃ tathācāmaṃ datvā devāya mantravit /
analyzed: ardhyam pādyam tathā ācāmam da tvā devāya mantra vid
translated: Having offered the respectful water, water for washing the feet, and water for sipping, to the god, the knower of the mantra,

analyzed: tatas tu parivārāṇi pātra śeṣeṇa kalpayet
translated: Then one should arrange the retinue with the remaining water in the vessel...

analyzed: parivāra kramam vakṣye yathātattvena yathātathyena nārada
translated: I will tell the sequence of the retinue as it truly is, as it really is, O Narada.

analyzed: āvāhana aṃśa toyena kalpeyat tu yathākramam
translated: One should arrange them in order with the water from the invocation...

analyzed: pūrve tu vāsudevam tu śuddha sphaṭika saṃnibham
translated: In the east, one should place Vāsudeva, who is like pure crystal,

analyzed: śaṅkha cakra gadā pāṇim pīta ambara vibhūṣitam
translated: With a conch, discus, and mace in his hands, adorned with yellow garments...

analyzed: saṃkarṣaṇam nyaset yāmye śaśi bāla arka saṃnibham
translated: In the south, one should place Saṅkarṣaṇa, who is like the moon, a young child, and the sun,

analyzed: śaṅkha cakra samopetam catur bāhu virājitam
translated: Endowed with conch and discus, adorned with four arms.

analyzed: pradyumnam paścime nyasya śātakumbha nibham mune
translated: In the west, O sage, one should place Pradyumna, resembling molten gold,

analyzed: śaṅkha cakra gadā pāṇim pīta ambara vibhūṣitam
translated: Having a conch, discus, and mace in his hands, adorned with yellow garments.

analyzed: aniruddham nyaset tasmin uttare nīla rūpiṇam
translated: In the north, one should place Aniruddha, having a blue form,

original: śaṅkhacakrasamāyuktaṃ pītavastraṃ caturbhujam // / //🔽śriyaṃ suvarṇavarṇābhāṃ śvetarūpāṃ sarasvatīm /
analyzed: śaṅkha cakra samāyuktam pīta vastram catur bhujam  śriyam suvarṇa varṇa ābhām śveta rūpām sarasvatīm
translated: Endowed with a conch and discus, wearing yellow garments, having four arms.🔽One should place Shri, having the complexion of gold, Saraswati having a white form,

analyzed: rakta varṇām ratim paścāt śāntim kuṅkuma saṃnibhām
translated: Rati having a red complexion, and Shanti having the color of saffron.

analyzed: āgneya ādiṣu koṇeṣu vinyaset śakti rūpakam
translated: In the southeast and other corners, one should place the form of Shakti.

original: paiśāce tu nyaset paścāt śaṅkhādīnāṃ tu nārada // / //
analyzed: paiśāce tu nyaset paścāt śaṅkha ādīnām tu nārada
translated: In the northwest, O Narada, one should place the conch and other (weapons).

original: pūrve śaṅkha niyuñjīta śvetavarṇaṃ saca /nādayuk /🔽kālāgnisadṛśākāraṃ dakṣiṇe cakramuttamam // / //
analyzed: pūrve śaṅkha niyuñjīta śveta varṇam  kālāgni sadṛśa ākāram dakṣiṇe cakram uttamam
translated: In the east, one should place the conch, having a white color and endowed with sound.🔽In the south, the excellent discus, having the form of the fire of dissolution.

analyzed: paścime tu gadām nyasya haridrā ābhām anuttamām  rakta varṇa nibham padmam uttare tu nyaset budhaḥ
translated: In the west, one should place the excellent mace, having the color of turmeric.🔽In the north, the wise one should place the lotus, having the color of red.

original: musalaṃ kṛṣṇavarṇaṃ tu āgneyyāṃ diśi vinyaset /
analyzed: musalam kṛṣṇa varṇam tu āgneyyām diśi vinyaset
translated: In the southeast direction, one should place the mace, having a black color.

analyzed: nairṛtāyām nyaset tatra khaṅgam ākāśa saṃnibham
translated: In the southwest, one should install the sword resembling the sky.

analyzed: pañca varṇa tathā śārṅgam vāyavye tantra vittamaḥ
translated: The best knower of tantra should place the five-colored Sharnga bow in the northwest.

analyzed: sarva varṇa maya ākārām vanamālām tathā aiśake
translated: And in the northeast, the garland of forest flowers having the form of all colors.

analyzed: etat dbrijīya āvaraṇam garbhāgāre prakīrtitam
translated: This is declared to be the principal covering in the sanctum.

analyzed: dvārasya dakṣiṇe caṇḍam kṛṣṇa varṇam catur bhujam
translated: To the right of the door, one should install Chandaka, black-colored, with four arms,

analyzed: śaṅkha cakra gadā pāṇim trinetram rakta locanam
translated: holding a conch, discus, and club, with three eyes and red eyes.

original: evaṃ rūpaṃ tu saṃcintya pracaṇḍaṃ tu tataḥ śṛṇu // / //
analyzed: evam rūpam tu saṃcintya pracaṇḍam tu tatas śṛṇu
translated: Having contemplated this form, then listen to Prachanda.

analyzed: śaṅkha cakra gadā pāṇim rakta varṇam catur bhujam
translated: Holding a conch, discus, and club, red-colored, with four arms,

analyzed: dvārasya uttara pārśve tu trinetram bhīma rūpiṇam
translated: on the left side of the door, with three eyes and a terrible form.

original: purato vainateyaṃ ca suvarṇābhaṃ kṛtāñjalim /🔽karaṇḍamakuṭaṃ nīlavāsasaṃ priyadarśanam // / //
analyzed: puratas vainateyam ca suvarṇa ābham kṛtāñjalim  karaṇḍa makuṭam nīla vāsasam priya darśanam
translated: In front, one should install Garuda, golden-hued, with folded hands,🔽wearing a skull-shaped crown, blue garments, and pleasing to behold.

analyzed: nīla agra nāsikā yuktam nāga ābharaṇa bhūṣitam
translated: Having a nose-tip like a blue lotus, adorned with serpent ornaments.

original: evaṃ tu garuḍaṃ cintya balarāmasya mūrtivat // / //
analyzed: evam tu garuḍam cintya balarāmasya mūrti vat
translated: Having thus contemplated Garuda, like the form of Balarama,

original: yo bhaktyā devamabhyarcet tathaiva garuḍaṃ yajet /
analyzed: yaḥ bhaktyā devam abhyarcet tathā eva garuḍam yajet
translated: one who devoutly worships the Lord and also worships Garuda,

analyzed: bhagavat pramukham paścāt garutmantam niyojayet
translated: The Lord should be placed in front, and Garuḍa should be placed behind.

analyzed: rakta varṇam catur bāhum dvi bāhum vā muni īśvara
translated: The Lord of the universe, the best of sages, should be contemplated as having a red complexion, four arms, or two arms,

analyzed: sarva ābharaṇa saṃyuktam sarva śobhana śobhitam
translated: adorned with all ornaments, shining with all beauty,

analyzed: kālāgni sadṛśa ākāram cakra dhṛk makuṭa anvitam
translated: having a form resembling the fire of dissolution, holding a discus, and wearing a crown.

original: evaṃ cakrādhidaivaṃ tu pūjayeddvārapārśvake // / //🔽śaṅkhābhaṃ saumyarūpaṃ tu sarvābharaṇabhūṣitam /
analyzed: evam cakra adhidaivam tu pūjayet dvāra pārśvake  śaṅkha ābham saumya rūpam tu sarva ābharaṇa bhūṣitam
translated: Thus, the presiding deity of the discus should be worshipped on the side of the door.🔽The deity of the conch should be contemplated as having a conch-like complexion, a peaceful form, adorned with all ornaments,

analyzed: upavīta yutam śvetam śaṅkha dhṛk makuṭa anvitam
translated: wearing a sacred thread, white, holding a conch, and wearing a crown,

original: caturbāhuṃ dvibāhuṃ vā dhyāyeddvārasya vāmake /🔽dhātāraṃ pītavarṇaṃ vidhātāramaruṇaprabham // / //
analyzed: catur bāhum dvi bāhum vā dhyāyet dvārasya vāmake  dhātāram pīta varṇam vidhātāram aruṇa prabham
translated: either with four arms or two arms, on the left side of the door.🔽Dhatri should be contemplated as having a yellow complexion, and Vidhatri as having a reddish-white complexion.

original: śyāmavarṇā tu bhūmiḥ syāt raktavarṇāṃ haripriyām /🔽durgāṃ ca komalaśyāmāṃ śvetarūpaṃ vināyakam // / //
analyzed: śyāma varṇā tu bhūmiḥ syāt rakta varṇām haripriyām  durgām ca komala śyāmām śveta rūpam vināyakam
translated: The earth should be contemplated as having a dark complexion, and Haripriya as having a red complexion.🔽Durga should be contemplated as having a tender dark complexion, Vinayaka as having a white form,

analyzed: śaṅkha padma nidhī ca eva śveta rakta nibhau mune
translated: and the deities of the conch and lotus treasures as having the complexions of a conch and red, O sage.

original: gaṅgāṃ ca yamunāṃ caiva śvetakṛṣṇanibhe mune // / //
analyzed: gaṅgām ca yamunām ca eva śveta kṛṣṇa nibhe mune
translated: The Ganges and Yamuna should be contemplated as having the complexions of a white conch and black, O sage.

original: utkarṣaṇīṃ tu raktāṃ vai karṣaṇīṃ raktavarṇakām /
analyzed: utkarṣaṇīm tu raktām vai karṣaṇīm rakta varṇakām
translated: Utkarshini should be contemplated as red, and Karshini as red-colored.

analyzed: evam dvāre tu saṃcintya tri sandhyāyāṃsu
translated: Thus, having contemplated at the door during the three junctions,

analyzed: prapūjayet
translated: one should worship.

analyzed: na arcayet upasandhyāyām caṇḍa ādīn dvārapālakān
translated: One should not worship Caṇḍa and other gatekeepers during the twilight.

analyzed: ajñānāt arcayet mohāt sthāna nāśaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If one worships out of ignorance or delusion, there will be loss of place.

analyzed: durbhikṣam jāyate rāṣṭram dhana dhānya vināśa kṛt
translated: Famine will occur in the country, destroying wealth and grain.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena vidhinā uktam samācaret
translated: Therefore, one should perform as prescribed with all effort.

analyzed: vimāna āgneya yāmye tu tad madhye gaṇanāyakam
translated: In the southeast and southwest mansions, in the middle of them, the chief of the Gaṇas,

original: pūrvavadvarṇakaṃ cintya hastivaktraṃ caturbhujam // / //🔽vimāne dakṣiṇe kuryāt dakṣiṇāmūrtimīśvaram /
analyzed: pūrvavat varṇakam cintya hasti vaktram catur bhujam  vimāne dakṣiṇe kuryāt dakṣiṇāmūrtim īśvaram
translated: contemplating the color as before, with the face of an elephant and four arms.🔽In the southern mansion, one should make the lord Dakṣiṇāmūrti,

analyzed: akṣa mālā dharam devam aṣṭa akṣara parāyaṇam
translated: the god holding a rosary, devoted to the eight-syllabled [mantra].

analyzed: trinetram śveta saṃkāśam saumyam soma ardha dhāriṇam
translated: Three-eyed, white-hued, gentle, holding the crescent moon,

analyzed: nārada ādi ṛṣi saṃghaiḥ ca sevitam dakṣiṇāmukham
translated: served by groups of sages such as Nārada, facing south.

analyzed: evam rahasya rūpam te saṃkṣepeṇa vidhīyate
translated: Thus, this secret form is prescribed for you in brief.

analyzed: tasya tu mātṝṇām uttarā mukham
translated: To the right of that, facing north, of the mothers,

analyzed: kalpayet muni śārdūla sarva saṃpad sukha āvaham
translated: one should create, O tiger among sages, bringing all prosperity and happiness.

analyzed: ālayasya uttare mātṝḥ kalpayet bā muni īśvara
translated: To the north of the abode, one should assign the Mothers, or else, O Lord of Sages.

analyzed: teṣām nāma kramāt guhyam śṛṇuṣva avahitaḥ dhunā
translated: Listen now with undivided attention to their secret names in due order.

analyzed: vāc īśvarī kriyā kīrtiḥ lakṣmī sṛṣṭiḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Vāgīśvarī, Kṛyā, Kīrti, Lakṣmī, Sṛṣṭi, and likewise,

original: vidyākāntiśca saptaitāḥ kathitā viṣṇumātaraḥ /🔽uttare paścime caiva hayāsyaḥ śrīdharastathā // / //
analyzed: vidyākāntiḥ ca saptā etāḥ kathitāḥ viṣṇu mātaraḥ  uttare paścime ca eva hayāsyaḥ śrīdharaḥ tathā
translated: Vidyā, and Kānti - these seven are declared to be the Mothers of Viṣṇu.🔽Hayagrīva and Śrīdhara should be placed in the north and west respectively.

translated: having placed in the middle of the pillar, one cubit high or two cubits high,

original: ekahastaṃ tathā bhūmau gartaṃ pīṭhādadhaḥ śubham /
analyzed: eka hastam tathā bhūmau gartam pīṭhāt adhas śubham
translated: and likewise one cubit deep in the ground, an auspicious base below the pedestal,

analyzed: stambhasya paritas kuryāt mekhalā tritayam budhaḥ
translated: the wise one should make three circular platforms around the pillar.

original: vṛttaṃ vā caturaśraṃ vā ṣoḍaśāṣṭāśrameva vā /
analyzed: vṛttam vā caturaśram vā ṣoḍaśa aṣṭa āśram eva vā
translated: Round or square, or even sixteen-sided,

analyzed: antara ādi tad utsedham aṅgulīnām yathākramam
translated: its height starting from the inside, in order,

analyzed: mekhalā ucchrāyam āyāmam ekaikam catur aṅgulam
translated: the platforms should be four fingers high and four fingers wide.

original: tālamātraṃ visṛjyaiva vedikāyāṃ samantataḥ // / //🔽paścāttu mekhalāḥ samyak kārayenmantravittamaḥ /
analyzed: tāla mātram visṛjya eva vedikāyām samantataḥ  paścāt tu mekhalāḥ samyak kārayet mantra vittamaḥ
translated: Having thrown it to a distance of a tala all around the altar,🔽The best knower of mantras should then properly make the girdles.

analyzed: mekhalānām atha ūrdhve tu vṛtta vedim samācaret
translated: Above the girdles, one should perform the circular altar.

analyzed: catur aṅgulam utsedham tad ūrdhve bja dalam padmakam likhet
translated: The height should be four fingers, and above that, one should draw the lotus petals.

analyzed: ṣoḍaśa dvādaśam vā api ca aṣṭa patram atha api vā
translated: It should have sixteen, twelve, or even eight petals.

original: dvyaṅgulaṃ tu ghanaṃ jñeyaṃ karṇikāsahitaṃ mune /
analyzed: dvi aṅgulam tu ghanam jñeyam karṇikā sahitam mune
translated: O sage, the thickness should be known as two fingers, along with the pericarp.

original: tryaṅgulaṃ tu tadutsedhaṃ dvyaṅgulaṃ tadghanaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: tri aṅgulam tu tad utsedham dvi aṅgulam tat ghanam bhavet
translated: The height of that should be three fingers, and its thickness should be two fingers.

analyzed: iti padma dalam vidhiḥ
translated: This is the method for the lotus petals.

analyzed: proktaḥ uttama adhama madhyataḥ
translated: The best, medium, and lowest have been mentioned.

analyzed: stambhasya paritas kuryāt sarva alaṃkāra saṃyutam
translated: One should make it all around the pillar, along with all ornaments.

analyzed: evam ukta prakāreṇa dhvaja pīṭham prakalpayet
translated: In this way, one should construct the flag-post.

analyzed: pūrvam vā api athavā paścāt kalpayet pīṭham uttamam
translated: One should make the excellent altar either in the east or the west.

analyzed: anyathā yadi ced vedim anartham aśubha āvaham
translated: If it is done otherwise, the altar brings misfortune and inauspiciousness.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena kārayet vidhi coditam
translated: Therefore, one should make it with all effort as prescribed by the rules.

analyzed: dhvaja stambham pravakṣyāmi viviktena mahā mune
translated: O great sage, I shall now describe the flag-post in detail.

original: candanaṃ campakaṃ vāpi bilvamarjunameva ca // / //🔽tekavṛkṣaṃ ca khadiraṃ sālaṃ tindukameva ca /
analyzed: candanam campakam vā api bilvam arjunam eva ca  ca khadiram sālam tindukam eva ca
translated: Sandalwood, campaka, bilva, and arjuna,🔽The teak tree, khadira, shala, and tinduka,

analyzed: campakam ca aṣṭakam ca eva kramukam nālikerakam
translated: Champaka, ashvattha, and coconut palm,

original: tālaṃ veṇuṃ tathaivātra saṃbhavena tu kārayet /
analyzed: tālam veṇum tathā eva atra saṃbhavena tu kārayet
translated: One should make it according to availability.

analyzed: śata tāla ardham ardham ca mukhya madhya adhamam kramāt
translated: One hundred palm trees, half of that, and half of that again - the best, medium, and lowest respectively,

analyzed: aśīti tālam icchanti kecid tasya ardham eva vā
translated: Some desire eighty palm trees, or half of that.

analyzed: gopura ākṛti tulyam syāt stambham adhyardham eva vā
translated: It should be equal to the size of a city gate, or half the height of the central pillar,

analyzed: stambha pramāṇam athavā tulyam adhyardham eva vā
translated: Or equal to the size of the pillar, or half of that.

analyzed: prāsādena samucchrāyam suṣira ādi vivarjitam
translated: The height should be equal to the palace, free from holes and so on.

analyzed: triṃśat aṅgula nāham tu mūladaṇḍasya nārada
translated: The girth of the base staff is thirty-six finger breadths, Narada.

analyzed: madhyamam ca aṣṭaviṃśat
translated: The middle part is twenty-eight.

analyzed: tad agram ṣaḍviṃśakam bhavet  hi adhastāt garuḍa ālayam
translated: The tip should be twenty-four.🔽Below, the Garudalaya should be made with three holes.

original: lohaṃ dārumayaṃ vāpi garuḍaṃ tatra yojayet // / //
analyzed: loham dāru mayam vā api garuḍam tatra yojayet
translated: One should install there a Garuda made of metal or wood,

analyzed: deva abhimukham āsīnam alpa kāyam kṛtāñjalim
translated: Seated facing the deity, with a small body, palms joined in prayer.

analyzed: ṣoḍaśa aṅgulakam vā api dvādaśa aṅgulakam tathā
translated: Or sixteen finger breadths, or twelve finger breadths,

analyzed: aṣṭa aṅgulam atha jñātvā kalpayet garuḍam mune
translated: Having known it to be eight finger breadths, one should fashion Garuḍa, O sage.

analyzed: tathā vā phalakam kām
translated: And likewise, a plank,

original: kṛtvā yathākāmaṃ munīśvara // / //🔽tanmadhye garuḍaṃ likhya svasthāne vinatāsutam /
analyzed: kṛtvā yathākāmam muni īśvara  tad madhye garuḍam likhya sva sthāne vinatā sutam
translated: Having made it as desired, O lord of sages.🔽In the middle of that, one should write Garuḍa, the son of Vinatā, in his own place.

analyzed: yojayitvā tatas kha īśam sthāpayet sva sva mantrataḥ
translated: Having joined it, one should install the lord of the sky with his own mantra.

analyzed: vedikā upari mantra jñaḥ su prapām parikalpayet
translated: The knower of mantras should imagine a good well on the altar,

analyzed: darbha mālā samāyuktam muktā dāma samanvitam
translated: Equipped with garlands of darbha grass and strings of pearls.

analyzed: prapāyām pūrva bhāga ādi patākāḥ tatra yojayet
translated: In the eastern part of the well, one should attach banners there.

analyzed: daśa hastam sapta hastam pañca hastam atha api vā
translated: Ten cubits, seven cubits, or five cubits,

analyzed: anyām aṣṭa karām yaṣṭim stambhe yantreṣu yojayet
translated: One should attach another eight-cubit pole to the pillar and the machine.

original: paṭasya lakṣaṇaṃ tasmin viśeṣaṃ kathaya mi te // / //
analyzed: paṭasya lakṣaṇam tasmin viśeṣam kathaya te
translated: In that, tell me the characteristics and specifications of the cloth.

analyzed: śṛṇuṣva avahitaḥ bhūtvā sarva saṃpad sukha āvaham
translated: Listen attentively to what brings about all prosperity and happiness.

analyzed: vā nava sapta paṭam bhavet
translated: It should be twelve cubits, ten cubits, or nine, seven, or five cloths.

analyzed: āyāmam iti saṃproktam vistāram adhunā ucyate
translated: The length has been described; now the width is being told.

analyzed: ṣaṣ sapta tāla vistāram dvāra vistāram ucyate
translated: The width of the door is said to be six or seven tālas.

original: pucchāyāmaṃ dvitālaṃ syāttatsamaṃ śira ucyate /🔽śirasā tu samau jñeyau bhūjau tasyārdhameva vā // / //
analyzed: puccha āyāmam dvi tālam syāt tad samam śiraḥ ucyate  śirasā tu samau jñeyau bhūjau tasya ardham eva vā
translated: The length of the tail should be two tālas, and the head is said to be of the same size.🔽The two arms should be known to be equal to the head or half of it.

original: bhujadvayavihīnaṃ vā paṭametadviśiṣyate /🔽kṣudraprāsādarūpaṃ cet navasaptapaṭaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: bhuja dvaya vihīnam vā paṭam etat viśiṣyate  kṣudra prāsāda rūpam ced nava sapta paṭam bhavet
translated: Or, this painting is superior if devoid of the two arms.🔽If it is in the form of a small palace, it should have nine or seven cloths.

analyzed: nava hastāt ca nū nyū
translated: And it should not be less than nine cubits.

analyzed: nam vai mahā gehe tu na iṣyate
translated: In a large house, it is not accepted.

original: yo mohāt kurute tasmin kriyā bhavati niṣphalā // / //🔽ālikhedgaruḍaṃ tatra suvarṇābhaṃ suvarcasam /
analyzed: yaḥ mohāt kurute tasmin kriyā bhavati niṣphalā  ālikhet garuḍam tatra suvarṇa ābham su varcasam
translated: If one foolishly performs rites in it, they become fruitless.🔽One should draw Garuḍa there, golden-hued and of good luster,

analyzed: iṣyate  nava tāla paricchinnam māna unmāna pramāṇataḥ
translated: with eyes fixed on the throat and navel, Garuḍa is considered to be of that height.🔽It should be nine tālas in size, measured by the standard measure.

analyzed: kiñcid āyata vṛtta akṣam rakta akṣam nīla nāsikam
translated: With slightly elongated and round eyes, red eyes, and a blue nose,

analyzed: utkuñcitam vāma pādam dakṣiṇam pṛṣṭhatas sthitam
translated: with the left foot bent, and the right foot placed behind,

analyzed: gagane gamana ārambham pakṣa vikṣepaṇa anvitam
translated: beginning to fly in the sky, accompanied by the flapping of wings,

analyzed: puṣpa añjali puṭa upetam raudram ca vinatā sutam
translated: the fierce son of Vinatā, holding a handful of flowers in his beak,

analyzed: nāga ābharaṇa saṃvītam smita āsyam kanaka aṅgadam  karaṇḍa makuṭam nīla vāsasam priya darśanam
translated: Adorned with serpent ornaments, with a smiling face, and golden bracelets,🔽Wearing a skull crown, blue garments, and pleasing to behold,

analyzed: su rakta pāṇi aṅghri talam daṃṣṭrābhyām ujjvala ānanam
translated: With very red palms and soles, and a radiant face with fangs,

analyzed: anantaḥ vāmakaṭakaḥ yajñasūtram tu vāsukiḥ
translated: Ananta is the armlet on the left, and Vasuki is the sacred thread,

analyzed: takṣakaḥ kaṭisūtram tu hāraḥ karkoṭakaḥ tathā
translated: Takshaka is the waistband, and Karkotaka is the necklace,

analyzed: padmaḥ dakṣiṇa karṇe tu mahāpadmaḥ tu vāmataḥ
translated: Padma is on the right ear, and Mahapadma is on the left,

original: śaṅkhaḥ śiraḥ pradeśe tu gulikastu bhujāntare // / //
analyzed: śaṅkhaḥ śiraḥ pradeśe tu gulikaḥ tu bhujāntare
translated: Shankha is on the head, and Gulika is in the arm,

analyzed: etaiḥ aṣṭa uragaiḥ ādyaiḥ bhūṣitam bhujaga uttamaiḥ  ananta gulikau viprau raktau vahni samudbhavau
translated: Adorned with these eight foremost serpents, beginning with Ananta,🔽Ananta and Gulika are Brahmins, red, born from fire,

original: vāsukiḥ śaṅkhapālaśca pītau candrodbhavau nṛpau /🔽mahākṣabja /🔽takṣakau veśyau śuklau vārisamudbhavau // / //
analyzed: vāsukiḥ śaṅkhapālaḥ ca pītau candra udbhavau nṛpau  mahākṣabja  takṣakau veśyau śuklau vāri samudbhavau
translated: Vasuki and Shankhapala are yellow, born from the moon, kings,🔽Mahapadma and Karkotaka are Vaishyas, white, born from water,

analyzed: padma karkoṭakau śūdrau kṛṣṇau vāyu samudbhavau
translated: Padma and Takshaka are Shudras, black, born from the wind.

original: likhitvā garuḍaṃ tatra chatraṃ copari kalpayet // / //
analyzed: likhitvā garuḍam tatra chatram ca upari kalpayet
translated: Having drawn Garuda there, one should imagine an umbrella above,

analyzed: atho mṛtasya kalaśam padmam ca eva atra saṃlikhet
translated: And then draw a pot of nectar and a lotus here,

original: tābhyāmubhayataḥ kuryāt dīpau dvau śubhadarśanau // / //🔽citrābhāsapratiṣṭhāṃ tu kārayenmantravittamaḥ /
analyzed: tābhyām ubhayatas kuryāt dīpau dvau śubha darśanau  citra ābhāsa pratiṣṭhām tu kārayet mantra vittamaḥ
translated: On both sides of them, one should place two lamps, auspicious to behold.🔽The one most skilled in mantras should cause to be made the installation of the variegated light.

analyzed: chāyā adhivāsanam kuryāt jalam saṃhṛtya deśikaḥ
translated: The preceptor, having withdrawn the water, should perform the consecration of the shadow.

analyzed: śāyayitvā tatas vedyām saṃhṛtya utpādya tattvataḥ
translated: Having laid it down on the altar, having withdrawn it and produced it truly,

analyzed: dhānya rāśim vinikṣipya vedi madhye samantataḥ  vedikā kalaśeṣu aṣṭau ananta ādīn prapūjayet
translated: Having placed a heap of grain all around in the middle of the altar,🔽In the pitchers on the altar, one should worship Ananta and others.

analyzed: śaṅkha ādi maṅgalānām tu vinyaset paritas kramāt
translated: One should place in order the auspicious things beginning with the conch all around.

original: pūrve śaṅkhaṃ niyuñjīta āgneye cakrameva ca /🔽yāmye tu vinyaset ketuṃ śriyaṃ vai nairṛte tathā // / //🔽darpaṇaṃ vāruṇe bhāge vṛṣabhaṃ vāyugocare /
analyzed: pūrve śaṅkham niyuñjīta āgneye cakram eva ca  yāmye tu vinyaset ketum śriyam vai nairṛte tathā  darpaṇam vāruṇe bhāge vṛṣabham vāyugocare
translated: In the east, one should employ the conch, and in the southeast, the discus itself.🔽In the south, one should place the banner, and in the southwest, Shri.🔽In the west, one should place the mirror, and in the northwest, the bull.

analyzed: some tu matsya yugmam tu kumbham īśāna gocare
translated: In the north, one should place the pair of fish, and in the northeast, the pitcher.

analyzed: evam tu maṅgalān  nyasya pūrva ādi krama yogataḥ
translated: Thus, one should place the auspicious things.🔽Having placed them in the pitchers in the order beginning with the east,

analyzed: pūjayet kalaśeṣu aṣṭa maṅgalāni yathākramam
translated: One should worship the eight auspicious things in order.

analyzed: vāsobhiḥ veṣṭiteṣu eṣu nikṣipta kanakeṣu ca
translated: Having wrapped them in cloths and placed gold inside them,

original: vāsāṃsi madhye saṃstīrya garuḍaṃ tatra śāyayet // / //🔽pratyaggrīvaṃ tato vastraiḥ saṃcchādya patageśvaram /
analyzed: vāsāṃsi madhye saṃstīrya garuḍam tatra śāyayet  pratyak grīvam tatas vastraiḥ saṃcchādya pataga īśvaram
translated: Having spread garments in the middle, Garuda should be laid there.🔽Then, having covered the lord of birds with garments, with its neck turned to the west,

analyzed: tasya dakṣiṇatas kumbham vinyaset taṇḍula upari
translated: To its right, a pot should be placed on top of rice grains.

analyzed: vāri pūrṇam su saṃvītam sa daśena ahatena tu  śuklena ambara yugmena mṛdunā su śubhena ca
translated: Filled with water, well-covered, with a new and unbroken🔽Pair of white garments, soft and very auspicious,

analyzed: sa ratnam hema saṃyuktam sa apidhānam sa kūrcakam
translated: With jewels and gold, with a lid and a fringe,

analyzed: tasmin āvāhayet devam garuḍam vinatā sutam
translated: In that, one should invoke the god Garuda, the son of Vinata.

analyzed: āvāhana vidhim samyak pravakṣyāmi mahā mune
translated: O great sage, I shall fully explain the method of invocation.

original: sauvarṇaṃ rājataṃ pātraṃ tāmraṃ mṛṇmayameva vā // / //
analyzed: sauvarṇam rājatam pātram tāmram mṛṇmayam eva vā
translated: A vessel made of gold, silver, copper or clay,

analyzed: āḍhakena tu saṃpūrṇam payobhiḥ vāribhiḥ tu vā
translated: Filled with a prastha measure of milk or water,

analyzed: tad pātre devam āvāhya ākāśāt mantra vittamaḥ
translated: In that vessel, the knower of mantras should invoke the god from the sky.

analyzed: ehi ehi khaga rāja indra vainateya mahā bala
translated: Come, come, O lord of the king of birds, son of Vinata, of great strength,

original: sāṃnidhyaṃ pārṣadaiḥ sārdhaṃ kuru tubhyaṃ namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: sāṃnidhyam pārṣadaiḥ sārdham kuru tubhyam namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Be present along with your attendants, salutations to you again and again.

analyzed: tad pātra patitam devam ānayet kumbha toyake
translated: The god who has fallen into that vessel should be brought into the water pot.

analyzed: mūlamantreṇa mantra jñaḥ tat mantram adhunā ucyate
translated: The mantra-knower, with the root mantra, recites that mantra now.

original: oṃ namo 'ṣṭakulanāgabhūṣaṇāya vainateyāya nāgaśoṇitadigdhāṅgāya suparṇāya saptapātālavāsine pakṣirājāya bhagavadvāhanāya garuḍāya trailokyakṣobhaṇāya
analyzed: om namaḥ ṣṭa kula nāga bhūṣaṇāya vainateyāya nāga śoṇita digdha aṅgāya suparṇāya sapta pātāla vāsine pakṣirājāya bhagavat vāhanāya garuḍāya trailokya kṣobhaṇāya
translated: Om, salutations to the one adorned with the eight-hooded serpent, to Garuḍa, whose body is smeared with serpent blood, to the excellent bird, to the lord of the birds, to the vehicle of the Lord, to Garuḍa, to the one who agitates the three worlds,

analyzed: yugānta bījāya mātuḥ arthe  śoka nāśāya hana hana
translated: to the seed of the end of the yuga, for the sake of the mother.🔽To destroy sorrow, han han.

analyzed: vighna nāśāya svāhā
translated: To destroy obstacles, svāhā.

original: anena tu svamantreṇa stutvā tu vihageśvaram /
analyzed: anena tu sva mantreṇa stutvā tu vihageśvaram
translated: Having thus praised the lord of birds with one's own mantra,

analyzed: sāṃnidhyam kalpayet tatra pakṣirājasya sarvadā
translated: one should always establish the presence of the king of birds there.

analyzed: evam āhūya garuḍam dhvaja mudrām pradarśayet
translated: Having thus invoked Garuḍa, one should display the flag mudrā,

original: vāmasyopari saṃsthāpya dakṣiṇaṃ tu karaṃ samam // / //
analyzed: vāmasya upari saṃsthāpya dakṣiṇam tu karam samam
translated: placing the right hand evenly above the left,

analyzed: aṅguṣṭham cālayet tatra dhvaja mudrām pradarśayet
translated: one should move the thumb there and display the flag mudrā.

analyzed: evam mudrām prakurvīta garuḍam sarpa bhūṣaṇam
translated: One should thus make the mudrā of Garuḍa, adorned with serpents.

analyzed: gandha ādibhiḥ samabhyarcya dhūpa dīpa antam eva hi
translated: Having worshipped with scents etc. up to incense and lamps,

original: tataḥ paṭagataṃ bimbaṃ śayānaṃ garuḍasya tu // / //
analyzed: tatas paṭa gatam bimbam śayānam garuḍasya tu
translated: then, on the cloth, the image of Garuḍa lying down,

analyzed: laya mārgeṇa saṃhṛtya punar utpādayet kramāt
translated: Having withdrawn through the path of dissolution, one should again produce in order

analyzed: pṛthivī ādini yathākramam
translated: the principles beginning with earth, the seeds, and so on, in due order.

analyzed: sa vācakāni vinyasya mantra deham prakalpayet
translated: Having assigned the expressive syllables, one should conceive the body of the mantra.

analyzed: sakalīkaraṇam kṛtvā dhyāna mārgeṇa deśikaḥ
translated: Having performed the sakalīkaraṇa, the preceptor, through the path of meditation,

analyzed: kumbha sthitena toyena prokṣayet tam sva vidyayā
translated: should sprinkle him with the water contained in the pitcher with his own Vidyā.

analyzed: pūrva ādi kalaśa stha adbhiḥ ananta ādīn sva nāmabhiḥ
translated: With the water from the pitchers beginning with the east, one should sprinkle Ananta and others with their own names,

analyzed: praṇava ādi namaḥ ntaiḥ ca kuśaiḥ saṃprokṣayet kramāt
translated: beginning with Om and ending with salutations, and with the Kuśa grass, one should sprinkle in order.

analyzed: sāṃnidhyam prārthayitvā tu yāvat yāga avasānakam
translated: Having requested for the presence, until the end of the sacrifice,

original: tataḥ saṃpūjayet sarvairupacāraiḥ khageśvaram /🔽ghṛtāplutaṃ tu mudgānnaṃ naivedyaṃ parikalpayet // / //
analyzed: tatas saṃpūjayet sarvaiḥ upacāraiḥ khageśvaram  ghṛta āplutam tu mudga annam naivedyam parikalpayet
translated: one should then worship the Lord of Birds with all the offerings.🔽One should conceive the offering of food with beans and rice dipped in ghee.

analyzed: mukha vāsam pradāya atha homa karma samārabhet
translated: Having offered mouth perfume, one should then commence the rite of homa.

original: sthaṇḍilaṃ tu caturdikṣu kṛtvā tatra vidhānataḥ // / //
analyzed: sthaṇḍilam tu catur dikṣu kṛtvā tatra vidhānataḥ
translated: Having made the sacrificial ground in the four directions according to the rules,

analyzed: vaiṣṇava agnim nidhāya atra homa karma samārabhet
translated: having placed the Vaiṣṇava fire here, one should commence the rite of homa.

analyzed: samidh ājyena caruṇā pratyekam śatam aṣṭa ca

analyzed: gandha puṣpaiḥ samabhyarcya sva nāmnā eva pṛthak pṛthak  tatas maṇḍapa vedyām ca nikṣipet śāli saṃcayam

analyzed: sa sūtram vastra yugmena veṣṭitam ratna saṃyutam
translated: Wrapped with a pair of cloths, containing jewels, with a thread,

analyzed: aṣṭa śakti samāyuktam sauvarṇa āyudha pañca yuj
translated: Endowed with eight powers, and with five golden weapons,

analyzed: tad kumbham praṇavena eva śāli padme tu vinyaset
translated: He should place that pot on the shali lotus with the praṇava.

analyzed: tatas padma daleṣu aṣṭa kalaśān paritas nyaset
translated: Then he should place eight water pots around on the lotus petals,

analyzed: pūrvavat toya saṃpūrṇān sa hiraṇyān sa vastrakān  sa apidhānān sa kūrcān ca mukhe ca aśvattha pallavān
translated: Filled with water as before, with gold, with cloths,🔽With lids, with darbha grass rings, and twigs of the holy fig tree at the mouth,

analyzed: pūjayet mūlamantreṇa tad tad mūrtim anusmaran

analyzed: vāsudeva aniruddha antam
translated: From Vasudeva to Aniruddha,

analyzed: nyaset pūrva ādi dikṣu ca

analyzed: nyaset śriyā diśā antyantam āgneya ādi vidikṣu ca

analyzed: evam nyasya vidhānena gandha puṣpa ādibhiḥ yajet

analyzed: evam homam praśaṃsanti eka homena ca api alam

analyzed: kārayet caturaśre tu juhuyāt tat vidhānataḥ

analyzed: vaiṣṇavīkaraṇa arthāya kuṇḍam pūrvavat ācaret

analyzed: tad kuṇḍe muni śārdūlaḥ ācāryaḥ homam ācaret

analyzed: samidh ājyena caruṇā juhuyāt tu punar punar

analyzed: samidhaḥ mūlamantreṇa praṇavena ājyam eva ca

analyzed: carum puruṣasūktena pratyekam ṣoḍaśa āhutīḥ

analyzed: evam hutvā vidhānena punar ājyena homayet

analyzed: samyak jñātvā muni śreṣṭha kālyām tu juhuyāt kramāt
translated: Then, having fully understood the Narayana Sukta that describes creation and so on, O best of sages, one should offer oblations to Kali in sequence.

analyzed: pañca upaniṣadaiḥ mantraiḥ juhuyāt tu punar punar
translated: With the mantras of the five Upanishads, one should offer oblations again and again.

analyzed: pūrva uktena vidhānena pūjayet haviḥ antakam

analyzed: dvādaśa akṣara mantreṇa mūrtimantreṇa ca eva hi

analyzed: prokṣayet mūlamantreṇa tat sūtram tu punar punar

analyzed: rātrau mahā utsavam kuryāt śaṅkha tūrya ādi nisvanaiḥ

analyzed: kautukam samalaṃkṛtya taṇḍula upari nārada

translated: Then, going around the village, with a multitude of great lamps,

analyzed: bandhayet kautukam paścāt pūrva uktena vidhānataḥ

analyzed: rātrau homaḥ prakartavyaḥ jala saṃprokṣaṇam divā

translated: One should not sprinkle at night, and one should not perform the homa during the day.

translated: Therefore, with all effort, one should perform the homa at night.🔽In the morning, at an auspicious moment, one should sprinkle with water in order.

analyzed: prokṣayet tu vidhānena bimba ādi āvaraṇa antikam

analyzed: āvāhayet tatas devam nārāyaṇam anāmayam

analyzed: śaṅkha cakra dharam devam pītavāsasam acyutam

translated: Adorned with all ornaments, shining with a garland of wild flowers.

translated: Having a conch-like neck, long arms, and a slightly smiling face,

analyzed: evam dhyātvā mahā viṣṇum garuḍa upari saṃsthitam
translated: Having meditated on Maha Vishnu in this way, seated on Garuda,

analyzed: saha dvādaśabhiḥ ca eva mūrtibhiḥ daśabhiḥ tathā
translated: Along with the twelve forms and the ten,

translated: With the Lokapalas, Adityas, Rudras, Vasus,

analyzed: evam dhyātvā mahā viṣṇum nārāyaṇam anāmayam
translated: Having meditated on Maha Vishnu, Narayana, the infallible one, in this way,

analyzed: śeṣa udakena matimān prokṣayet parivārakam

analyzed: tatas puruṣasūktena pūjayet puruṣottamam
translated: Then, with the Purusha Sukta, he should worship Purushottama, the supreme being,

analyzed: haviḥ nivedayet paścāt pūrva uktena vidhānataḥ

analyzed: iti samyak samākhyātaḥ jala saṃprokṣaṇa kramaḥ

analyzed: etat vicārya kartavyam

analyzed: pañcarātra viśāradaiḥ

analyzed: iti śrī pāñcarātre viṣvaksenasaṃhitāyām pīṭhacalanādinimitta prokṣaṇavidhiḥ nāma aṣṭatriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-eighth chapter named the method of sprinkling for the purpose of moving the altar etc. in the Viṣvaksena Sanhitā of the Śrī Pañcarātra.

analyzed: viṣvaksenaḥ
translated: Viṣvaksena

analyzed: atas param pravakṣyāmi prāyaścitta vidhim param
translated: Hereafter I shall expound the supreme method of expiation,

analyzed: pūjana ādiṣu sarvāsu kriyāsu muni sattama
translated: In all the rites such as worship etc., O best of sages.

analyzed: prātar sandhyā arcanā hīne madhyāhne dviguṇam caret

analyzed: prātar madhyāhnayoḥ hīne sāyāhne triguṇam caret

analyzed: eka aham arcanā hīne upavāsa vratam caret

analyzed: kalaśaiḥ navabhiḥ snāpya pūrva uktena vidhānataḥ

analyzed: puṇyāham vācayet tatra bhojyāḥ vai brāhmaṇāḥ trayaḥ

analyzed: arcayitvā yathānyāyam pūrva uktena vidhānataḥ

analyzed: evam eva tu kartavyam dvādaśa aha antam eva ca

analyzed: pakṣa hīnam bhavet tasmin snāpayet adhama uttamam
translated: If it is missed for a fortnight, one should bathe the lowest and best.

translated: There, twelve Brahmins should be fed with milk pudding.🔽If there is a deficiency of a month, it should be made up by Vastu Homa.

analyzed: adhama uttama mārgeṇa snapanam kārayet hareḥ
translated: The ablution of Hari should be performed according to the best and medium procedures.

analyzed: puṇyāham vācayet tatra pūjayet pūrvavat kramāt
translated: There, the priest should recite the Punyha Mantras and worship as before in order.

analyzed: brāhmaṇān bhojayet tatra śiṣṭān pañcadaśa adhikān
translated: There, he should feed the Brahmins, the remaining fifteen.

original: etat krameṇa kṛtvā tu trimāsāntaṃ viśeṣataḥ /

translated: Having done this in order, especially at the end of three months,

analyzed: tri māsa ādīni ṣaṣ māsāt arvāk pūjā vilopane
translated: From three months to six months, if the worship is discontinued,

analyzed: saṃmārjya antar bahis geham prakṣālya vidhivat tadā
translated: Having cleaned the inside and outside of the house, having washed it according to the rules,

analyzed: dhūpayitvā agaru dhūpena puṇyāham tatra kārayet
translated: Having fumigated with aloe wood incense, the priest should perform the Punyha there.

analyzed: uttama uttama mārgam vā hi ekāśīti krameṇa vā
translated: Or according to the best of the best procedure, or in the order of the Aṣṭāṣṭaka,

analyzed: snāpayet devadeveśam yathā vitta anusārataḥ
translated: The priest should bathe the Lord of the Lord of gods according to his means.

analyzed: brāhmaṇān bhojapet tatra pūrvavat homam ācaret
translated: There, he should feed the Brahmins and perform the Homa as before.

analyzed: mahā haviḥ nivedya atha pūjayet puruṣottamam
translated: Having offered the great oblation, he should worship the Supreme Being.

original: tataḥ paraṃ trivarṣāt prāk snapaṃna cottamottamam /

analyzed: snāpayet muni śārdūla pūrva uktena vidhānataḥ

analyzed: brāhmaṇān bhojayet tatra yathā vitta anusārataḥ
translated: There, one should feed the Brahmins according to one's wealth.

original: tadūrdhvaṃ dvādaśādarvāk prāyaścittaṃ vidhīyate // / //🔽praṇavena nirīkṣyātha garbhagehaṃ tu sādhakaḥ /

analyzed: pañcagavyam kramāt kṛtvā garbhāgāram vidhodhayet  uttama uttama mārgam vā api athavā madhyamam tu vā
translated: Having performed the five products of the cow in order, one should purify the womb-house.

analyzed: snāpayet devadeveśam yathā vibhava vistaram
translated: One should bathe the Lord of the Lord of gods either with the best of the best path or with the medium path, according to one's wealth and extent.

analyzed: brāhmaṇān bhojayet tatra yathā vitta anusārataḥ
translated: There, one should feed the Brahmins according to one's wealth.

analyzed: śānti homam krāmat kṛtvā pūrvavat pūjayeta harim
translated: Having performed the Shanti Homa as before, one should worship Hari as before.

analyzed: atas ūrdhvam muni śreṣṭha prāyaścitam vidhīyate
translated: Above that, O best of sages, expiation is prescribed.

analyzed: jala saṃprokṣaṇam kuryāt puṇya aha ukti puraḥsaram
translated: One should sprinkle water, preceded by the utterance of auspicious words.

analyzed: brāhmaṇān bhojayet tatra tena śāntiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: There, one should feed the Brahmins, by which there will be peace.

analyzed: pūjā aṅga dravya hīnam ced arghya ādi haviḥ antakam
translated: If there is a deficiency in the offering materials, starting from the Arghya up to the oblations,

analyzed: adhama uttama mārgeṇa snāpayet beram uttamam

analyzed: eka bera vidhāne tu prāyaścittam vidhīyate

analyzed: snapanam sthāvara arcāyām kartavyam vidhivat sadā
